summary: This is an email forwarding a proposed redaction filing from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to Judge Nathan in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It shows the defense counsel communicating with the court regarding modifications to a protective order.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sends the email attaching Ghislaine Maxwell's proposed redactions to a court filing regarding modification of a protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; her defense team is submitting proposed redactions to a filing on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who requested the submission of the proposed redactions to the court.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the correspondence and proposed redactions are addressed.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the internal email regarding the court filing.

persons.name: Ann Lundberg
persons.context: A defense attorney or legal staff member for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the internal email regarding the court filing.

connections.description: Pagliuca is a defense attorney acting on behalf of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by him requesting the submission of her proposed redactions.
Simmons is sending the filing at Pagliuca's request, indicating they work together on Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
Menninger is copied on the internal defense team email regarding Maxwell's court filing, indicating her role on the defense team.
Lundberg is copied on the internal defense team email regarding Maxwell's court filing, indicating her role on the defense team.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Submits Proposed Redactions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, via Nicole Simmons, submits proposed redactions to a 'Request and Reply in Support of Modifying the Protective Order' to Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: The document is an email from August 24, 2020, related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330).
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including attorneys Jeffrey S. Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Ann Lundberg, is actively filing motions and proposed redactions with the court.
The specific legal action involves a 'Request and Reply in Support of Modifying the Protective Order,' indicating ongoing litigation over the secrecy of case materials.
The communication shows the defense law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Alison J. Nathan (referred to as Judge Nathan) is the presiding judge for this phase of the case.
